intro: Delphinastrum nudicaule, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Delphinastrum nudicaule is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in grassland ecosystems.
